children.content:
# GitHub Actions

Feishu Pages è®¾è®¡å°±æ˜¯ç”¨æ¥ç»“åˆ GitHub Actionsã€GitLab CI ä¹‹ç±»çš„æŒç»­é›†æˆæµç¨‹å†…ä½¿ç”¨ã€‚è¿™æ ·æˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡è®¾å®šå‘¨æœŸæ€§ã€æˆ– Webhook è§¦å‘çš„æ–¹å¼æ¥å®ç°é£ä¹¦æ–‡æ¡£å˜æ›´ï¼ŒåŒæ—¶è§¦å‘æ–‡æ¡£è‡ªåŠ¨å‘å¸ƒçš„åŠ¨ä½œã€‚

## Installation

åœ¨ä½ çš„ GitHub é¡¹ç›®ä¸­æ–°å¢ `.github/workflows/feishu-pages.yml`

```yaml
on:
  push:
jobs:
  feishu-pages:
    name: Feishu Pages Export
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Setup node
        env:
          FEISHU_APP_ID: ${{ secrets.FEISHU_APP_ID }}
          FEISHU_APP_SECRET: ${{ secrets.FEISHU_APP_SECRET }}
          FEISHU_SPACE_ID: ${{ secrets.FEISHU_SPACE_ID }}
        uses: longbridgeapp/feishu-pages@main
```

children.title: Feishu Docx
children.content:
# Feishu Docx

`feishu-docx` æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå¯ä»¥æ”¯æŒå°†é£ä¹¦ Docx æ–‡æ¡£æ ¼å¼è½¬æ¢ä¸ºå…¶ä»–ä»»æ„æ ¼å¼çš„å®ç°ã€‚

è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªç‹¬ç«‹çš„ NPM åº“ï¼Œä½ å¯ä»¥è‡ªç”±å¼•å…¥åˆ°è‡ªå·±çš„å‰ç«¯é¡¹ç›®ä¸­ä½¿ç”¨ã€‚

ç›®å‰æ”¯æŒæ ¼å¼ï¼š

- Markdown (GFM)

## **Installation**

```bash
yarn add feishu-docx
```

## **Usage**

```ts
import { MarkdownRenderer } from 'feishu-docx'

// Load docx JSON from file
const docx = fs.readFileSync('test.json')
const render = new MarkdownRenderer(docx)
const text = render.parse();
const imageTokens = render.imageTokens;
```

## æ”¯æŒé£ä¹¦ Block ç±»å‹

- Text
- Heading1
- Heading2
- Heading3
- Heading4
- Heading5
- Heading6
- Heading7
- Heading8
- Heading9
- Bullet
- Ordered
- Code
- Quote
- TodoList
- Divider
- Image
- Table

## **License**

MIT

children.title: Getting Started
children.content:
# Getting Started
ğŸ‰ This site build by GitHub Actions with feishu-pages.
Feishu Pages is a tool for exporting Feishu Wiki into Markdown files, with [Static Page Generator](https://www.google.com/search?q=Static+Page+Generator) tools to publish the docs as static web pages. Support Formats: [Supported Formats](NWEWw9rscidWVbkjmCac43cJnWf) ## **Features** - [feishu-docx](https://github.com/longbridgeapp/feishu-pages/tree/main/feishu-docx) - Convert feishu docx into Markdown format. - Keeping the original sidebar. - Download images locally. - Working with GitHub Actions and other CI tools. - Generate [Docusaurus](https://docusaurus.io/) supported Markdown format, for the sidebar. (based on `sidebar_position`) - For example use VitePress: [VitePress](N7Cvw1mFmi5BbckuPSfcJ96unJd) ## **Installation** Feishu Pages can install via Npm into your Static Page Generator project. For example, if we have a [Docusaurus](https://docusaurus.io/) project. ```bash cd your-project/ yarn add feishu-pages ``` And then you can run `yarn feishu-pages` to export the Feishu docs. This command will export the docs with `.md` files. ## **Feishu Permissions** - `docx:document:readonly` - `wiki:wiki:readonly` - `drive:drive:readonly` ## **Configuration** |Name|Description|Required|Default| |---|---|---|---| |FEISHU_APP_ID|Feishu App ID|YES|| |FEISHU_APP_SECRET|Feishu App Secret|YES|| |FEISHU_SPACE_ID|Feishu Knowledge Base ID|YES|| |ASSET_BASE_URL|Base URL of resource files (images, attachments), configure the URL prefix of img src through this configuration||/assets| |OUTPUT_DIR|Output directory||./dist| ## **Usage** ### **Create Feishu app and grant permissions** 1. Visit [https://open.feishu.cn/app ](https://open.feishu.cn/app)Create a new app and get: - `App ``ID` - `App Secret `- Please take care to keep the App Secret and do not leak it to the Internet. 2. Enable the `robot `application capability for the application. 3. Enable the `docx: document: readonly `and `wiki: wiki: readonly `permissions for the app. 4. Release the official version of the application and ensure approval . 5. Create a new group `Feishu Pages `in Feishu IM, add the application as the group bot, the Knowledge Base administrator adds it in "Wiki Workspace Settings" - > "Permission Settings" - > "Add Administrator", and add this `Feishu Pages `group as an **administrator **. - Otherwise you will encounter `permission denied: wiki space permission denied `error. [ref](https://open.feishu.cn/document/server-docs/docs/wiki-v2/wiki-qa) ### **Get the Feishu Knowledge Base ****space_id** We need to configure `FEISHU_SPACE_ID `environment variables, which is the `space_id `of Feishu Knowledge Base. You can access the Knowledge Base settings interface and get them from the URL. For example: `https://your-company.feishu.cn/wiki/settings/6992046856314306562 `here `6992046856314306562 `for `space_id `. ### **Environment variables configuration** Feishu Pages supports `.env `files, if the root directory has a `.env `file, it will be automatically read. > Please refer `to .env.default `to configure environment variables. If you need to use it in the CI process of GitHub Actions, it is recommended to add it to Secrets and get it through environment variables. ## **Exporting Markdown Documents from Knowledge Base** ```bash cd your-project/ yarn feishu-pages ``` According to the default configuration above, Markdown files and exported image files will be generated in the `./dist `directory. If you want to adjust the directory, you can set `OUTPUT_DIR `environment variables yourself. ## **FAQs** ### **Rate Limit Related Errors** > Error: request trigger frequency limit The Feishu API has a [total frequency limit ](https://open.feishu.cn/document/ukTMukTMukTM/uUzN04SN3QjL1cDN)of 100 requests per minute. This project implements a delay of 300ms before each request to avoid exceeding this frequency. If you encounter such problems, please submit an issue. ## **License** MIT

children.title: Supported Formats
children.content:
# Supported Formats This article is used to demonstrate the formats that feishu-docx can perfectly support after exporting, and the ones listed below can all have good support. Due to the limited data provided by Feishu OpenAPI , feishu-docx export cannot restore 100% of the format in Feishu Docs, and can actually achieve 99% of the effect. **Known unsupported formats:** - Base - Feishu Base (spreadsheet) is independent data, and the data format is large and complex, which is not supported for the time being. Please use **ordinary tables **when writing documents. - Flowchart / UML diagram / Drawing board / Mindmap - the above are the sub-application functions of Feishu Docs, and the Feishu Docs currently docked does not provide such data or pictures, so it cannot be realized. - Image size, cropping - the image will be output in the original way, because the Feishu OpenAPI does not give the image cropping and scaling size information, so the exported content does not contain width, height, this can be based on the final page setting image 100% width to achieve. - Formula - not supported yet, this may be supported later. - Other Feishu third-party components - this cannot be supported, API does not provide data. - Text color - The foreground color and background color of the text are not supported for the time being due to Markdown output. Based on the above, it is recommended to use supported formats as much as possible when writing documents on the Feishu side. The formats that are currently supported can meet the document formatting needs of document writing (such as help documents, blogs) and other scenarios. --- # Here is the full format demonstration ## This is heading 2 ### This is heading 3 #### This is heading 4 ##### This is heading 5 ###### This is heading 6 > This is a block quote. > With a new line. ## Paragraph Export Feishu Knowledge Base and generate [Static Page Generator ](https://www.google.com/search?q=Static+Page+Generator)with the same directory structure supports `Markdown `file organization for publishing as a **static website **. Generate **Feishu Wiki** into a Markdown for work with Static Page Generators. ## Callout
Red Callout
ğŸ’¡ Orange Callout
ğŸ¤– Yellow Callout
âœ… Green Callout
ğŸ³ Blue Callout
ğŸ³ Purple Callout
ğŸ¼ Gray Callout
## Grid Here is a 3 column grid example:
## Bullet List - Projects - GitHub - Twitter - x.com - Facebook - OpenSource - feishu-pages - feishu-docx ## Ordered List 1. This is 1 item 1. This is a item 1. This is i 2. This is b 3. This c 2. This is 2 item 1. This is 2.1 2. This is 2.2 ## CodeBlock A JSON example: ```json { "name": "feishu-pages", } ``` A TypeScript example: ```ts const name = "feishu-pages"; ``` ## TODO - [x] This item is completed - [ ] This is imcomplete ## Divider There is a divider --- To split contents. ## Image An example of an image with caption. ## File [test-file.zip](MO5Ob83I6oe6fVxmgGEchkiTnUc) ## Table Currently, feishu-docx only supports pure Table. |Name|Type|Website| |---|---|---| |GitHub|Programming|https://github.com| |Twitter|Social Network|https://x.com| |Dribbble|Design|https://dribbble.com|

children.title: Page Mata
children.content:
# Page Mata By default, Feishu Wiki did not provide any features that allowed us to specify the page URL. So, we need to use a special way to do that. ## Pages Meta You can write a `CodeBlock` with `YAML` or `JSON` language at the first of your Feishu Document. | | | | |---|---|---| |Field|Type|Description| |slug|string|To specify the URL filename of this page.
For example: `hello-world`
Then the page URL will:
`https://your-site.com/path/of/folder/`**hello-world**
> `path/of/folder` is the nested paths by the TOC.| |hide|bool|Hide this page, if present `true` this page will ignore and not shown on Sidebar.
Default: `false`| After the page is generated, the Page Meta part will be invisible. ## For example Here is a screenshot of Page Meta in the Feishu Document. Add `YAML` or `JSON` content: ```yaml slug: your-page-slug ``` If you'd like to use `JSON`, write like this. ```json { "slug": "your-page-slug" } ``` Then this `CodeBlock` will parse to as doc meta info, and this `CodeBlock` will not appear in the output Markdown content.

children.title: Internationalization
children.content: # Internationalization Feishu Docs and Feishu Knowledge Base do not support Internationalization, so we can not add translations in different languages to the same document. Therefore, we need some special mechanisms to achieve internationalization support for our project in the feishu-pages process. ## Directory structure You need to put multiple languages together in the Feishu Knowledge Base and put different languages into different root nodes. As needed, create the Internationalization version required in the root directory, such as Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, English, etc., and add [Page Mata](J1o5w2l0NiV8tekJvXycfkkengb)to these files to define the basic slug, and then put the content of different languages under it. The directory structure needs to be constructed like this (with Page Meta information in parentheses): ```yaml ç®€ä½“ä¸­æ–‡ (slug: zh-CN) å¿«é€Ÿå¼€å§‹ æ”¯æŒçš„å†…å®¹æ ¼å¼ ... English (slug: en) Getting Started Support Formats ... ``` The directory of Feishu Knowledge Base is roughly like this: ## Static Page Generator Configuration By using the above method, after exporting the Markdown file from feishu-pages, you will obtain the following file structure: ```yaml â”œâ”€â”€ en â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ assets â”‚Â Â  â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ ABxwbknVxoL2c4xjgrVcMgDWnOh.png â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ feishu-docx.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ gettting-started.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ intergration-deploy â”‚Â Â  â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ github-actions.md â”‚Â Â  â”‚Â Â  â””â”€â”€ gitlab-ci.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ intergration-deploy.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ page-meta.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ static-page â”‚Â Â  â”‚Â Â  â””â”€â”€ vite-press.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ static-page.md â”‚Â Â  â””â”€â”€ supported-formats.md â”œâ”€â”€ en.md â”œâ”€â”€ zh-CN â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ assets â”‚Â Â  â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ AOilbSy20oC6Wlx8qtUc9ok5nLb.png â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ feishu-docx.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ gettting-started.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ intergration-deploy â”‚Â Â  â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ github-actions.md â”‚Â Â  â”‚Â Â  â””â”€â”€ gitlab-ci.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ intergration-deploy.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ page-meta.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ static-page â”‚Â Â  â”‚Â Â  â””â”€â”€ vite-press.md â”‚Â Â  â”œâ”€â”€ static-page.md â”‚Â Â  â””â”€â”€ supported-formats.md â””â”€â”€ zh-CN.md ``` As can be seen from the above structure, `zh-CN `and `en `are placed in different files. At the same time, the `docs.json `file generated by feishu-pages also has such a directory tree structure. If you want to get `zh-CN `or `en `, you can find the node with `slug `as `zh-CN `or `en `through JavaScript traversal. Now you can freely implement multi-language support according to the method supported by Static Page Generator. The details of each specific tool are different, so I won't go into detail here. ### VitePress Configuration Reference If you are using VitePress, you can refer to this configuration: https://github.com/longbridgeapp/feishu-pages/blob/main/example-website/.vitepress/config.mts

children.title: Static Page Generator
VitePress

children.content:
# Static Page Generator Feishu Pages supports collaboration with various Static Page Generators.
ğŸ¸ With the Static Page Generator, you can get a purely static document website.
When exporting documents, you will get the following two key files and some folders: - `Assets `- Store attachments such as images - `Docs `- stores all Markdown files already organized according to directory hierarchy. - `Docs/SUMMARY.md `- Catalog indexes for tools like GitBook and mdBook. - `Docs.json `- All document trees in JSON format. ## Known feasible options - [VitePress](https://vitepress.dev/) - [Docusaurus](https://docusaurus.io/) - [GitBook](https://www.gitbook.com/) - [mdBook](https://rust-lang.github.io/mdBook/)

children.title: Integration Deploy
GitHub Actions
children.content:
# GitHub Actions

Feishu Pages is designed to be used in conjunction with continuous integration processes such as GitHub Actions and GitLab CI. This way, we can achieve Feishu Docs changes by setting up periodicity or Webhook triggering, and trigger the action of document automatic publication.

## Installation

Add to your GitHub project `.github/workflows/feishu-pages.yml`

```yaml
on:
  push:
jobs:
  feishu-pages:
    name: Feishu Pages Export
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Setup node
        env:
          FEISHU_APP_ID: ${{ secrets.FEISHU_APP_ID }}
          FEISHU_APP_SECRET: ${{ secrets.FEISHU_APP_SECRET }}
          FEISHU_SPACE_ID: ${{ secrets.FEISHU_SPACE_ID }}
        uses: longbridgeapp/feishu-pages@main
```

children.title: Feishu Docx
children.content:
# Feishu Docx

`Feishu-docx `is an implementation that supports converting the Feishu Docx document format to any other format.

This is an independent NPM library that you can freely import and use in your own front-end projects.

Currently supported formats:

- Markdown (GFM)

## **Installation**

```bash
yarn add feishu-docx
```

## **Usage**

```ts
import { MarkdownRenderer } from 'feishu-docx'

// Load docx JSON from file
const docx = fs.readFileSync('test.json')
const render = new MarkdownRenderer(docx)
const text = render.parse();
const imageTokens = render.imageTokens;
```

## Feishu Block Type

- Text
- Heading1
- Heading2
- Heading3
- Heading4
- Heading5
- Heading6
- Heading7
- Heading8
- Heading9
- Bullet
- Ordered
- Code
- Quote
- TodoList
- Divider
- Image
- Table

## **License**

MIT
